intro: Tetrapterys donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Tetrapterys donnell-smithii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
